intro: Brachyscome marginata, commonly known as the margined everlasting or margined daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–30 cm and features bright yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale blue ray flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy regions. Brachyscome marginata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is commonly cultivated in gardens for its long-lasting blooms.
